item.title: Using mobile-specific HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (Mobile web part 5)
item.description: (updated June 27, 2011) Mobile-specific HTML Viewport tag Use the viewport tag to properly fit the content to the screen: 1 <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"/> Tel scheme (to initiate phone calls) 1 <a href="tel:18005555555">Call us at 1-800-555-5555</a> Sms scheme (to initiate text messages) 1 2 3 <a href="sms:18005555555"> <a href="sms:18005555555,18005555556"> <!-- multiple recipients --> <a href="sms:18005555555?body=Text%20goes%20here"> <!-- predefined message body --> Disable automatic telephone number linking 1 <meta name="format-detection" content="telephone=no"> iOS-specific HTML (some work on Android as well) You also have access to several Apple-specific tags to use in your iOS applications (iPhone, iPad, and don’t forget the iPod Touch!
